meanings.definition: A small partitioned-off area of a room, especially one containing a desk.
meanings.sent1: In the office, each employee has their own cubicle to work in.
meanings.sent2: The cubicle at the library was perfect for studying in peace.
meanings.sent3: The cubicle in the cafe was so tiny, it felt like a cozy closet.
meanings.sent4: Her cubicle at work was like a little island of productivity amidst the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The cubicle was so cramped, it felt like a mini office pod.

meanings.definition: A small private room in a public space.
meanings.sent1: The airport had cubicles where travelers could rest in privacy.
meanings.sent2: The spa offered luxurious cubicles for guests to relax in.
meanings.sent3: The cubicle at the park was a hidden gem for a quick nap.
meanings.sent4: His cubicle at the gym was a sanctuary away from the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent5: The cubicle provided a peaceful retreat from the bustling city outside.
